contexto.texto_completo:
# Architectural Patterns Context

## Layered Architecture
A layered architecture organizes the system into horizontal layers, each with specific responsibilities.
Typically includes: presentation layer, business logic layer, data access layer.
Common files: separate folders for 'views', 'models', 'controllers', 'services', 'repositories'.

## Model-View-Controller (MVC)
MVC separates application into three interconnected components:
- Model: data and business logic
- View: user interface
- Controller: handles input and updates model/view
Common files: 'models/', 'views/', 'controllers/' directories.

## Microservices Architecture
Microservices architecture structures an application as a collection of loosely coupled services.
Each service is independently deployable and scalable.
Common files: multiple independent service directories, Docker files, API gateways, message queues.

## Pipe-and-Filter Architecture
Data flows through a series of processing components (filters) connected by channels (pipes).
Each filter transforms data and passes it to the next filter.
Common files: pipeline scripts, data transformation modules, stream processing.

## Event-Driven Architecture
System produces, detects, and reacts to events asynchronously.
Components communicate through event messages.
Common files: event handlers, message brokers, pub/sub patterns, event listeners.

## Monolithic Architecture
All components are tightly integrated into a single, unified codebase.
Common files: single large application with minimal separation of concerns.

## Orchestrator-Executor Architecture
Central orchestrator coordinates and manages execution of tasks by executor components.
Common files: orchestration engine, task definitions, workflow management, executor services.

## Multi-Agent Architecture
System composed of multiple autonomous agents that collaborate and communicate.
Each agent has specific capabilities and can make independent decisions.
Common files: agent modules, communication protocols, coordination mechanisms, agent registries.
contexto.descricao: Descrições detalhadas de cada padrão arquitetural para melhorar a classificação
